text: the way in which humans are choosing
their sexual partners is changing
rapidly right now in most species that
we know of that reproduce sexually the
way that they choose their sexual
partners has really big influence on
their evolution so the ways in which
people are finding potential romantic
partners has undergone this revolution
just in the last 10 20 years so for
example online dating or the use of
dating apps to find potential romantic
partners might actually be affecting our
evolution today and in some ways that
might be affecting us in ways that are
different for men than for women and
that's because we know that evolution
influences traits that has to do with
how attractive we are two of the
opposite sex and how it people perceive
attraction in members of the opposite
sex so for example we know that men tend
to rely more on visual cues when
determining whether they find a member
of the opposite sex to be attractive
women tend to rely on a wider range of
cues when evaluating men including
visual cues but also including things
like smell women are able to use smell
in order to determine how closely or
distantly related a man is to her smell
cues are not readily accessible through
the internet or through apps and so it
might be hard for women to use the cues
that they have evolved in order to make
sort of evolutionarily informed make
choices and so it might be that online
dating is working more to the
evolutionary advantage of men than it is
of women
[Music]
